conclusion: To determine the internal resistance of the silicon photocell, we need to analyze the given U-I graph.
Line a intersects the U-axis at 5 V.
Line a intersects the I-axis at approximately 0.4 A.
The intersection of line b and line a occurs at U = 2.5 V and I = 0.2 A.
Operating point is U = 2.5 V and I = 0.2 A.
The internal resistance can be found using the relationship between the open-circuit voltage, short-circuit current, and the operating point.
The internal resistance r is given by the slope of the line from the open-circuit voltage to the operating point: r = (U_oc - U) / I.
Substituting the known values: r = (5 V - 2.5 V) / 0.2 A = 2.5 V / 0.2 A = 12.5 Ω.
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell at this light intensity is 12.5 Ω.
